name: Dinner Tonight: Creamiest White Beans with Leeks
description: That cheeky title could come from no one else but Jamie Oliver—too bad he buried the recipe. His new cookbook, Cook with Jamie, is stocked full of great looking recipes, a few of which we’ve already tried for this column....

recipeInstructions.text: Pour oil and butter into a saucepan and turn the heat to medium-low. Add the leek, thyme, and garlic and cook until soft, about 20 minutes.
Crank the heat to high, and pour in the wine or vermouth. When it comes to a boil, add the beans and turn heat to medium. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Turn off the heat, toss in the chopped parsley and the creme fraiche, and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
